text:
62 yo F PMH of afib, TIA, memory loss s/p hypoglycemic coma, chronic
   low back pain, anemia, GERD, asthma recently admitted with
   subarachnoid/intraparenchymal hemorrhage [**Date range (1) 5700**] and readmitted to
   MICU with acute change in mental status  [**Date range (1) 5858**] being readmitted
   with acute hypercarbic respiratory failure.
   .
   She was just discharged yesterday [**3-2**] from MICU course for altered
   mental status and hypercarbia. Her altered mental status was likely
   multifactorial to include medications (diazepam, percocet) and
   hypercarbia [**12-18**] OSA and sleep hypoventilation. She returned to baseline
   on discharge. Her hypercarbia was thought related to her COPD and
   likely newly diagnosed sleep disordered breathing. She underwent a
   sleep study and was discharged on  BiPAP to follow up in sleep clinic
   for a complete sleep study.
   .
   She was found somnolent this morning, was not placed on BiPaP last
   night. Sent to [**Hospital1 1711**] for CO2 115. At [**Hospital1 1711**] placed on BiPap with
   excellent response and transferred to [**Hospital1 **]. On the EMS she was taken off
   BIPAP and placed on high flow oxygen. By arrival she was altered with
   saturations in 70s. She was trialed on CPAP with no success and bagged
   to try and take off CO2 with no success and subsequently intubated and
   admitted to MICU. CTH negative.
   Respiratory failure, acute (not ARDS/[**Doctor Last Name 76**])
   Assessment:
   Hypercarbic CO2 of 139, lethargic upon arrival at ED. Sedated with
   propofol but became hypotensive to the 80
s switched to versed 6 mgs
   /hr. stable vital signs upon arrival at MICU
 sats > 95% denies pain.
   Awake and following commands, bilateral wrist immobilizer in place.
   Patient intermittently restless and anxious, wanted to take tube out
   and have drink of juice/water, initial ABG upon arrival at MICU
   7.54/55/48
   Action:
   Vent settings adjusted with ABG results, placed on AC 30% FiO2 300
   Response:
   Plan:
   Diabetes Mellitus (DM), Type II
   Assessment:
   Action:
   Response:
   Plan:

info.concept: Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease of horses
